name: Lad Na Noodles Recipe (Rad Na Thai Gravy)
description: This authentic lad na noodles recipe is made with fresh wide rice noodles (sen yai), Chinese broccoli, and an irresistibly Thai gravy.

video.name: The best Thai food, Thai noodles with pork gravy! Rad Na recipe #thaifood  #thairecipe #porkrecipe #food

recipeIngredient: 600 g fresh flat rice noodles ((for dry rice noodles, use a little less than half the weight))
200 g Chinese broccoli (stems peeled, leaves chopped)

itemListElement.text: Crack the egg into a large bowl and combine it with palm sugar, oyster sauce, tapioca starch, and the sliced pork meat. Mix thoroughly, then let it rest in your fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight.
itemListElement.name: Crack the egg into a large bowl and combine it with palm sugar, oyster sauce, tapioca starch, and the sliced pork meat. Mix thoroughly, then let it rest in your fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight.

itemListElement.text: Remove the outer layer from the Chinese broccoli stems, then slice the stems into thin pieces, and roughly chop the leaves and the garlic.
itemListElement.name: Remove the outer layer from the Chinese broccoli stems, then slice the stems into thin pieces, and roughly chop the leaves and the garlic.

itemListElement.text: In a large mixing bowl, combine soybean paste, white pepper, light soy sauce, rosdee seasoning powder, and crack in both eggs. Combine until well blended.
itemListElement.name: In a large mixing bowl, combine soybean paste, white pepper, light soy sauce, rosdee seasoning powder, and crack in both eggs. Combine until well blended.

itemListElement.text: In a separate cup, thoroughly mix tapioca starch and 3.4 floz of water.
itemListElement.name: In a separate cup, thoroughly mix tapioca starch and 3.4 floz of water.

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, combine the fresh rice noodles with black soy sauce. If you’re using dry noodles, first soak them in water according to package labeling. Use your hand and a plastic glove to mix. Next, stir-fry the noodles for just 2 minutes and set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, combine the fresh rice noodles with black soy sauce. If you’re using dry noodles, first soak them in water according to package labeling. Use your hand and a plastic glove to mix. Next, stir-fry the noodles for just 2 minutes and set aside.

itemListElement.text: In the same pan over medium heat, add oil and garlic, fry until it turns golden brown.
itemListElement.name: In the same pan over medium heat, add oil and garlic, fry until it turns golden brown.

itemListElement.text: Add water and bring to a boil. When boiling, add pork and spread out the meat to ensure it doesn’t stick to each other.
itemListElement.name: Add water and bring to a boil. When boiling, add pork and spread out the meat to ensure it doesn’t stick to each other.

itemListElement.text: Add the mix of gravy prepared in step 3 once the water comes to a boil. Stir gently just to mix. The clutched egg will float to the top, this is normal. The egg gives a firmer structure to the sauce and a rich taste.
itemListElement.name: Add the mix of gravy prepared in step 3 once the water comes to a boil. Stir gently just to mix. The clutched egg will float to the top, this is normal. The egg gives a firmer structure to the sauce and a rich taste.

itemListElement.text: Add Chinese broccoli and let boil for 2 more minutes, or until soft enough.
itemListElement.name: Add Chinese broccoli and let boil for 2 more minutes, or until soft enough.

itemListElement.text: Give your tapioca starch and water mixture another stir. Make sure your gravy is boiling and pour it in as you stir the gravy. Keep stirring afterward to make sure it gets well mixed with the gravy (important!!).
itemListElement.name: Give your tapioca starch and water mixture another stir. Make sure your gravy is boiling and pour it in as you stir the gravy. Keep stirring afterward to make sure it gets well mixed with the gravy (important!!).

itemListElement.text: When the lad na sauce thickens, your gravy is ready.
itemListElement.name: When the lad na sauce thickens, your gravy is ready.

itemListElement.text: To serve your Thai gravy, place the stir-fried noodles in a bowl or on a large plate and pour the gravy over them.
itemListElement.name: To serve your Thai gravy, place the stir-fried noodles in a bowl or on a large plate and pour the gravy over them.

review.reviewBody: Very good recipe.  The rad na I used to eat in Bangkok had a lot more sweet soy sauce in the gravy, but other than that, spot on!  My wife and son loved it!  Thank you very much!

keywords: lad na, rad na, thai gravy
